intro: Adicea atroviridis, commonly known as the black-veined flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with dark green veins. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters and are typically found during the cooler months. Adicea atroviridis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil types.
